title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

vmassol joined #xwiki at 02:37  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:53): I just dug up something interesting, the administration application works without AdminAction.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:53): example: http://127.0.0.1:8081/xwikiTrunk/bin/inline/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?xpage=admin&editor=globaladmin&section=Registration  
sdumitriu - (02:54): Hm, it shouldn't  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:56): Why not? security?  
sdumitriu - (02:56): Yep  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:57): The next thing I was going to mention is that the administration application form posts to bin/save/XWiki/XWikiPreferences  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:57): so admin right seems to be redundant.  
sdumitriu - (02:58): Indeed  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:59): Interesting thing about the AdminAction is it seems it was meant to have data posted to it, I see no place where that happens.

GillesSerasset - (11:32): hi all  
vmassol - (11:33): hi Gilles  
GillesSerasset - (11:33): when I do a $request.get("param") or a $request.param in velocity  
GillesSerasset - (11:33): I get an incorectly decoded value  
GillesSerasset - (11:34): for instance .../WebHome?param=été  
GillesSerasset - (11:34): $request.param gives me Ã©tÃ©  
GillesSerasset - (11:34): is this new behaviour ? I'm surprised not to find any bug about this in jira  
vmassol - (11:37): GillesSerasset: I see that in a jira issue sergiu has pointed to a wrong tomcat configuration that you may have. Have you checked it out?  
GillesSerasset - (11:38): issue nb ?  
vmassol - (11:39): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XATAG-32?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel&focusedCommentId=48608#action\_48608  
GillesSerasset - (11:40): OK, I'm checking, I did not receive the notification  
GillesSerasset - (11:51): thanks Sergiu, tomcat conf fixed the pb  
mflorea - (11:57): sdumitriu: re http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4346 I checked on FF 3.5.7, IE 6/7/8, Opera 9.x and Epiphany+WebKit (~Safari) and the full screen editing works fine. I'd like to commit the change before 2.2RC2, wdyt?

vmassol - (12:09): tmortagne: if you have any idea why http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/ fails to render....  
bblfish - (12:10): so I want to use the following in XWiki - http://github.com/harbulot/keygenapp/blob/master/samplewebapp/src/main/java/uk/ac/manchester/\_rcs/bruno/keygenapp/webapp/MiniCaServlet.java  
tmortagne - (12:10): vmassol: looking  
bblfish - (12:10): I studied how to build components  
bblfish - (12:10): I think that should work out quite well. I can do all that in a component I think  
tmortagne - (12:10): vmassol: "Wrapped Exception: null " sounds like there is a nullpointer exception somewhere  
vmassol - (12:11): that I agree :)  
tmortagne - (12:11): looking at the code but it's looks like a bug for sure  
bbc581 joined #xwiki at 12:14

bblfish - (12:23): now my component is so small it won't even have a user interface. That's because it receives a post from the browser, and returns a certificate that will arrive in the browser in an invisible i-frame (It would be cook to do some AJAX perhaps to update part of the UI, but that is something one could do later)  
tmortagne - (12:24): vmassol: note that tehre is some velocity comment outside of velocity (but it does not seems to be the issue, just a review of the content ;))  
bblfish - (12:25): Just wondering where I would put such an invisible component. In a wiki page?  
tmortagne - (12:25): vmassol: FYI i reduced the failing content to http://pastebin.com/m1baedf97, i will debug it  
tmortagne - (12:26): i don't see anything fancy in it...  
vmassol - (12:26): lunch, bbl  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 12:28  
tmortagne - (12:33): i can reproduce it in 2.2 and 2.1 snapshots, creating jira and fixing it after lunch  
bblfish - (12:44): ok I sent a detailed explanation of what I am about to do. Let me know if it makes sense. :-)  
bblfish - (12:45): I sent it to the mailing list.  
anamarias - (13:04): hi  
anamarias - (13:04): How do I find out the wiki page of a macro having a MacroDescriptor?  
anamarias - (13:05): lets say I have this: macroManager.getMacro(macroId).getDescriptor()  
anamarias - (13:07): what I have is a list of MacroDescriptors, and I need to find out for each of them : 1/ if it's a java or a wiki macro 2/ the wiki page of the macro  
anamarias - (13:07): how do I do 1/ and 2/ ?

lucaa1 - (14:45): hi all  
lucaa1 - (14:46): I just noticed, in 2.1.1, if I have a doc with no title and a title 1 about the middle of the document, when displayed, the h1 is removed from its place in the middle of the doc and used as the title of the document  
lucaa1 - (14:46): is this known / fixed / normal?  
vmassol - (14:49): hmm is myxwiki.org answering for you?  
vmassol - (14:50): lucaa1: the "removal" part seems plain wrong  
lucaa1 - (14:51): vmassol: yes, it feels pretty odd, to have the title removed, and it also leaves the little edit section button hanging there (which makes it quite puzzling)  
vmassol - (14:55): could someone restart myxwiki.org?  
vmassol - (14:56): ah it's back

vmassol - (16:04): mflorea: ok. Can we do something about it? I thought I say you do some commits a few days ago to prevent some flickering  
mflorea - (16:08): vmassol: I've fixed others. I tried multiple times to fix http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests-2.1/lastBuild/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/testReport/junit/com.xpn.xwiki.it.selenium/TabsTest/testSwitchToSourceBeforeWysiwygLoad/ but I couldn't. I'll try again.  
mflorea - (16:10): I'll inspect http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests-2.2/lastBuild/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/testReport/junit/com.xpn.xwiki.it.selenium/RegularUserTest/testWikiLinkSearchedPageHidesBlacklistedSpaces/ too. I've seen it failing and then passing a few times.  
BrunoXLambert joined #xwiki at 16:27  
BrunoXLambert - (16:31): Is there any way to list the childDocument of a workspace?  
mflorea - (16:33): tmortagne: which is the right way to update l10n.xwiki.org after moving a translation file. In 2.3 branch, the WYSIWYG translation file is at http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/web/trunk/xwiki-gwt-wysiwyg-client/src/main/resources/org/xwiki/gwt/wysiwyg/client/Strings.properties . AFAICS, l10n.xwiki.org is not aware of platform versions. Looks like it will be tricky to update l10n.xwiki.org ...  
tmortagne - (16:35): mflorea: you should change the link in the translation file webhome, http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/inline/Wysiwyg/WidgetResources for example  
tmortagne - (16:35): make me think i should avoid printing the stats when in inline mode  
tmortagne - (16:36): mflorea: if you don't plan to remove keys form the file anytime soon it's ok for the version we can use the same l10n data for the stable branch and trunk  
tmortagne - (16:37): we could create kind of l10n branches i doubt it's needed right now  
mflorea - (16:38): tmortagne: I see. I don't plan to change the keys. So I'll leave the current link for now, ok?  
tmortagne - (16:39): mflorea: no you should change it for the trunk one anyway, the fact that you don't plan to remove keys just mean we don't need to have a different Transltion File for 2.2 branch  
mflorea - (16:39): ok  
tmortagne - (16:39): l10n should always point on trunk
